intro: Gouinia polygama, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of leaves near the ground. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Gouinia polygama is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
